item.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

summary.text: Declares that the Government of the People's Republic of China (PRC), given the global shortage of coke, should: (1) take the necessary steps to ensure that Chinese companies that export coke are not charging any form of export license fees for such exports; (2) remove any limitation on the quantity of coke that may be exported from the PRC; (3) allow more companies to export coke from the PRC in order to promote fair market pricing of that product; and (4) take the necessary steps to provide export licenses for coke without cost or delay.

bill.title: Urging the Government of the People's Republic of China to take certain actions regarding exports of coke.

item.title: Urging the Government of the People's Republic of China to take certain actions regarding exports of coke.
Urging the Government of the People's Republic of China to take certain actions regarding exports of coke.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
